intro: Trisetum trinii var. strictum, commonly known as the narrowleaf woodoat, is a perennial grass native to North America. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, spike-like inflorescences that bear numerous tiny florets. It thrives in moist to wet environments, often found in wetlands and along stream banks. Its botanical features make it an important species for ecological studies and wetland restoration projects.
